website_summaries.verdict: Provides a combination of quality material and convenient features along with a few strap and leakage concerns.
pros: Lightweight construction, breathable mesh, and cushioned interior combine to provide a comfortable fit
Comes with a 1.5 liter bladder that allows a generous amount of water to flow through the line
cons: Straps are prone to loosening when running, requiring readjustments
Some reports of leaks from the bladder

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hydration pack! I bought this for Ragnar, but used it at a half marathon first. It's not very big, but it has pockets in the front for your keys, phone and protein bar. There's a large pocket in the back for the water reservoir, but you can fit a few small items in there too. It's light, it says secure, no bouncing around. It doesn't make my back super sweaty either. The straps allow this pack to fit on a slender person or a bigger person like me.
customer_reviews.author: Maiz_Maiz

customer_reviews.title: Love the feel and fit
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel and fit! Make sure to prep it before your first run. I just filled it up and went for my run and my water tasted horrible! It tasted like plastic and chemicals mixed together. I learned the hard way that the first thing you need to do is fill it up some kind of mix consisting of apple cider vinegar, and baking soda (or something like that) to take away that nasty taste. There should have been some instructions on that. Anyway, other than that little misshap, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... done a few 10mile runs and it has been perfect no rubbing under my arms I am 5'6 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've done a few 10mile runs and it has been perfect no rubbing under my arms I am 5'6 and a 38 DDD and it buckles across my chest.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love this for running as a girl
customer_reviews.text: Love this for running as a girl! It doesn't squish the girls together and force them out. The straps that connect across the chest and stomach are adjustable so you can put them where it works for you. This is a great nag that's just the right size for water and carrying phone, keys, gels, etc without being bulky. I've used it for running, biking and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually fits and stands up to OCR racing!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a vest that actually fit! Don't believe some of those other ones that say they fit L/XL. This pack was perfect for the last Spartan Ultra Beast that I ran and plan to continue to use it for all my longer races!
customer_reviews.author: B. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great except for on minor thing
customer_reviews.text: Size is perfect. I use it for my long runs and for the most part, the bladder will hold enough water for a 20 mile run except for when it is 90+ degrees. But you can put bottles in the front if you need extra fluids. Good storage for phone and snacks. Only issue is the side and chest strap gets lose so you are constantly tightening while you are running. It isn’t enough to bother me, but it might bother others. Ran a couple marathons with it and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: you should be able to turn the bladder upside down and suck out the air
customer_reviews.text: I only used this twice, and the bladder leaks. Also, supposedly after you fill these things with water, you should be able to turn the bladder upside down and suck out the air... that is the key to not hearing the water slosh around while you run. Well I just can't seem to get that to work with this. Finally, I was wearing a tank, and I received some chaffing on my back after a run. I think posting a video on how exactly to fill the bladder, remove air, put the pack on and then clean it after a run is very needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack, it's the perfect size. Love the pockets in the front, supposed to be for extra water bottles but holds my iPhone 6s Plus with extra room and the other side holds my fuel!
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I used the CamelBak Hydration Vest during two half marathons and absolutely will use it again. I love being able to drink my hydration drink whenever I feel the need instead of waiting until I get to the next water station. My only complaint would be the ribbons/belts slide loose when running, but as long as you tie them in a knot, they stay in place the entire race. I would definitely buy this product again. It was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! It adjusts easily. Top pocket holds an iPhone easily and protects it from sweat. I like that the sides are open for venting out heat unlike other brands. The easy adjustment is perfect for adapting to be worn over jackets or tank tops. I had no issue with chafing. Weight distributed well without creating any hot spots
customer_reviews.author: Warrior Woman

customer_reviews.title: Nice hydration pack for running
customer_reviews.text: Nice hydration pack for running. There's room to stash some items in the pack area near the Camelback hydration pack, and also some additional pockets, including one zipped one, on the vest straps. My complaint is that it runs really small in the shoulders, and I don't think I have particularly wide shoulders (size 0-2 female), so keep that in mind when purchasing this hydration vest.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and functional!
customer_reviews.text: I run and bike ride with this vest. I love it. I finally found something that is lightweight and keeps liquids close by. The only thing that prevents me from giving it a 5 star is that I am a big woman and at first it appears its way too small. But after making adjustments, I got it to fit, but still would like a little more room for big chested women.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It is a one size fits all, but once you adjust it to your body, it rides very well. I use it for long trail runs up and down hills and it conforms to my body nicely. I added a soft Camelback bottle to one pocket to offset the balance of my phone in the other pocket. It’s very lightweight and thin so extra perspiration isn’t a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Carla S. Dekalb

customer_reviews.title: ... on my long runs and while the pockets are nice to have on the front but the chest straps ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use for hydration on my long runs and while the pockets are nice to have on the front but the chest straps don't stay tight and I have to re-tighten then often while running. The spout was hard to use as well. I will continue to use for shorter runs but not my go to for longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and held plenty of water and gel ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and held plenty of water and gel packs to get me in between water stations at the Lake Tahoe Spartan Race. Did not even notice it when I was running as the straps hold it in place on your body.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Trincado

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and cool to wear
customer_reviews.text: Light, comfortable and cool to wear. I have a 2 liter reservoir that fits in the vest nicely when I need more water on longer runs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dunsmore

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: Went on one long run with this so far and it was everything I expected. I live in the south so running during summertime is brutal but having this backpack, I was able to keep hydrated throughout the run and also have more than enough space to carry my nutrition as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Just requested a replacement, bladder leaked badly on it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Just requested a replacement, bladder leaked badly on it's maiden voyage run and I was soaked within 20 minutes. The vest fit well, was light, and I didn't get hot wearing it. Hoping the replacement has a bladder that doesn't leak- willing to give it another chance!
customer_reviews.author: Emily D

customer_reviews.title: Vest is great, reservoir leaks
customer_reviews.text: The vest is comfortable and light. I do need to pull the straps on the front while running to keep the vest tight. If the review was on the vest alone, I would give it a 4/5. The reservoir leaks so bad I cannot use it. I have experience with other reservoirs from Camelbak and never had them leak like this; I cannot walk without water coming out of the cap. I ended up getting water bottles to put in the front pockets.
customer_reviews.author: karaHahnSolo

customer_reviews.title: The bladder leaked horribly so I returned it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to run with at the Ragnar Trail Relay. The bladder leaked horribly so I returned it. Can't run soaking wet while all your water leaks out.
customer_reviews.author: MamaHolz

customer_reviews.title: Bladder leaks
customer_reviews.text: I used this vest twice and both times the bladder leaks. I check the bladder after I fill it with water to make sure that i have closed the cap tightly but it still leaks. I am very disappointed that it leaks. I have purchased other Camelbak products and the bladder have never leaked. The vest size is really nice and fits me perfect. I don't want to spend money on a new bladder and risk it leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my girlfriend and she uses it all the time for her long runs of 13 or more miles. She loves it and thanks me every time she uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than the older models.. cell phone fits nicely in the strap pocket... other pockets are perfect for keys, gels etc. I often fill the reservoir only half to keep weight down on shorter runs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Calcinari

customer_reviews.title: Holds everything nicely
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Water pouch didn't bounce like I thought it might. I carried my phone, keys, tissue and cards and wouldn't have known. I was a little warmer but not enough to really notice, was really just paying attention the first time wearing it
customer_reviews.author: Alana's Mum

customer_reviews.title: Great running pack!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 12mi trail race and it worked great! It's not too big and the pockets are perfect for gel packs, phone, money, etc. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Sargent

customer_reviews.title: CamelBack trail backpack and hydration.
customer_reviews.text: Well made bag, compact, light and has plenty of pockets to store your things for a long trail run.
customer_reviews.author: Briones

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, lots of pockets, but leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: Training for a marathon and was hoping to use this on long runs. Pros: Vest fits well and is comfortable Lots of pockets for keys, phone, Gu, etc Bite valve works well Cons: This thing leaks so badly that my back was drenched both times I used it. The gasket/cap does not seal well at. I think I lost a good half liter of water. Maybe I got a defective one ? Bottom line, if it didn’t leak so badly, it would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jonica M Yerzak

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed, I will look at another model
customer_reviews.text: The strap that holds the tank comes off on the first day, the side belts are constantly slipping, you have to tie it in a knot. The reservoir is inconvenient to get and clean. Extremely disappointed, I will look at another model.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Zotov

customer_reviews.title: tiny straps are hard to handle, difficult to get ...
customer_reviews.text: tiny straps are hard to handle, difficult to get over my shoulder and I'm not a big guy. Just difficult to adjust all around.
customer_reviews.author: archaeo

customer_reviews.title: I love this design and the light weight style
customer_reviews.text: I love this design and the light weight style. I have owned several camelback's over the years. This one has a bladder that does not secure properly when screwed on and leaks out all the fluid! I am not happy. I contacted Camelbak and they said it may be defective. I'm afraid it is a fault in the design of the reservoir. I will be returning this and replacing it with a new one. We will see if it is correct.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Ramirez

product_meta.title: CamelBak Circuit Hydration Vest, 50oz
product_meta.description: One of our most popular running vests just got an upgrade. The new version of the Circuit is 30% lighter and includes a 1.5-liter Crux reservoir that delivers 20% more water per sip. And of course, it still offers all of the features that make it a favorite for bonk-free races and long runs: front storage pockets for gels and fuel, a secure zippered pocket that fits most phones, and reflectivity to keep you visible when you’re on the move. The two fully adjustable sternum straps guarantee a snug, bounce-free fit that won’t constrict your breathing when you’re panting through a hilly workout. One Size: Fiits Chests 28 inches - 46 inches)
feature_bullets: The Crux Reservoir delivers 20% more water per sip, with an ergonomic handle for easier refilling, and an on/off lever that makes it easy to prevent leaks.
3D Ventilated mesh offers multi-directional air flow and cushioning to maximize comfort and breathability
Secure phone pocket conveniently located for quick access and includes a zipper closure for added security
Dual adjustable sternum straps increases stability and offer a range of adjustments for customization
Reflectivity on front and back for early morning or evening runs

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
